result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith R Lueloff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
On Count #2 the Court IMPOSES 6 months jail with Huber, but STAYS the sentence and places Mr. Lueloff on Probation for a term of 1 year.

[Shall the STAYED sentence be imposed Mr.Lueloff is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.]

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 4:02pm [mo]
Defendant Keith R Lueloff in court with Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

On Count #2 the Court IMPOSES 6 months jail with Huber, but STAYS the sentence and places Mr. Lueloff on Probation for a term of 1 year, with conditions:
[Shall the STAYED sentence be imposed Mr.Lueloff is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.]


--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to any other undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening, per agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no contact with Nicole Tasker, Jonathan Rusch,Allison Peot or Benjamin Harmon
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent 
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay $25 drug testing fees
--$15 in subpoena fees

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 4:23pm

Case called at 11:34am [mo]
Defendant Keith R Lueloff in court with Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Nagel indicates that Mr. Lueloff was unable to come to Atty. Nagel's office due to housing situation.
Atty. Nagel requests that the Plea and Sentencing be re-scheduled 30 days out from today.
--no objection from ADA Beck

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
The Court directs ADA Beck to notify the Court is the analyst is not available on the scheduled jury trial date
The Court continues Mr. Lueloff's bond.
recess:11:43am

NEXT: 1)FSSC on 10/8/15 at 3:00pm  2)Jury Trial on 10/12/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 8:37am [mo]
Defendant Keith R Lueloff in court with Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Nagel requests a plea and sentencing date out 60 days to allow Mr. Lueloff to establish employment and residence
--DA Happ does not object

The Court notifies the parties that shall the plea and sentencing be scheduled out 60 days, the jail time will most likely be forthwith. The Court may consider a stay of jail time.
The Court reminds Mr. Lueloff that his bond and its conditions remain in effect

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing: 9/10/15 at 11:00am

[prior to hearing//off record: The Clerk confirs with Mr. Lueloff of his current address. Mr. Lueloff indicates that his mailing address is the Hwy. 18, Helenville address]
Def. NOH for the 7/16/15 STC & copy of STAO; return to sender, attempted not known; unable to forward
Request for substitution of attorney is granted. Attorney Nagel is now attorney of record
Proposed stip and order for substitution of attorney
Notice of Hearings sent to LKA
Status conference on June 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 3, 2015 at 01:40 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Keith R Lueloff
Current: 200 E. Truman Street, C/O Hilltop Motel, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 05-12-2015)
Prior: W3550 Us Hwy 18, Helenville, WI 53137

[MK] case called at 1:20pm. 
Defendant Keith R Lueloff appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Lueloff indicates that his date of birth is 7/31/1965 and that the Helenville address is his current mailing address, even though he is currently living at the Hilltop Motel. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense 

The Court requires a $2,000  signature bond, with conditions:

--no contact with Nichol Tasker, Jonathan  Rusch, or Ben Harmon
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a prescription
recess 1:23pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on June 3rd at 1:40pm  (2) Status Conference on  June 26th at 10:00am
